org.guicebox.failover
Class NonBlockingHeart

java.lang.Object
  org.guicebox.failover.NonBlockingHeart
All Implemented Interfaces:
Heart
@ThreadSafe
public final class NonBlockingHeart
extends Object
implements Heart

Utility for sending and receiving heartbeats. The actual wire protocol is implemented by Transport. This class is responsible for managing the background threads and firing events to the HeartbeatListener.

Author:
willhains

Method Summary

          Begins sending heartbeats, starting immediately and followed once every HeartbeatInterval milliseconds.

Method Detail

listen

public void listen(HeartbeatListener heartbeatListener)
Description copied from interface: Heart
Starts listening for heartbeats. Each time a heartbeat is received, the specified listener will get a HeartbeatListener.onHeartbeat(Heartbeat) callback. If no response is received within HeartbeatInterval x HeartbeatTolerance, the specified listener will get a HeartbeatListener.onHeartbeatTimeout() callback.

Specified by:
listen in interface Heart

beat

public void beat()
Description copied from interface: Heart
Begins sending heartbeats, starting immediately and followed once every HeartbeatInterval milliseconds.

Specified by:
beat in interface Heart

stopListening

public void stopListening()
Description copied from interface: Heart
Temporarily stops listening for heartbeats.

Specified by:
stopListening in interface Heart

stopBeating

public void stopBeating()
Description copied from interface: Heart
Temporarily stops sending heartbeats.

Specified by:
stopBeating in interface Heart

stop

public void stop()
Description copied from interface: Heart
Permanently stops sending/receiving heartbeats. The Heart cannot be used to send or receive heartbeats after calling this method. This method blocks until the internal listen & beat threads are completely shut down, unless the calling thread is interrupted.

Specified by:
stop in interface Heart
